intro: Calyptrella denticulata, commonly known as the toothed bladderwort, is a carnivorous plant belonging to the family Lentibulariaceae. It is characterized by its small, bladder-like structures used to trap microscopic aquatic organisms. The plant typically grows in wet, nutrient-poor environments such as bogs and marshes. Its leaves are often submerged, while its stems may be partially submerged or emergent. Calyptrella denticulata plays a unique role in its ecosystem by contributing to nutrient cycling through its predatory behavior.
